results.title: Another side of the forest = L'Autre visage de la foret
results.creator_credit: Raoul Fox, Strowan Robertson, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fascinating look at developments that aim to protect and conserve Canada’s vast forest reserves. Some of the experiments shown, both in laboratories and in the field include turning a Newfoundland bog into woodland, propagating British Columbia seedlings to withstand mechanical planting, inoculating Ontario elms against bark beetle and devising ways to control fire.
results.title_for_label: Another side of the forest = L’Autre visage de la foret
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raoul Fox, Strowan Robertson, Bill Brind, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Antiques for Everyone
results.brief_description: Antiques for Everyone dispels the myth that antiques are only for the rich, the collector or the expert. Renowned collector and antique dealer Kerry Trollope, takes you on an informative journey through the fascinating world of antiques of the 18th and 19th century. Covering four areas - glass, furniture, porcelain and silver - he explains dating techniques, restoration, various technical terms, investment aspects and the interesting combination of using antiques in a contemporary atmosphere. Rated: G

results.title: Another kind of music
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates and Fruits and Roots
results.brief_description: The story of four people from very different backgrounds, who are drawn together by their love of music. This simple story-line based around reggae music is designed to stimulate ideas on multiculturalism by emphaszing positive contributions of different cultures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates and Fruits and Roots

results.title: Antigonish
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From places far distant, students come to this quiet Nova Scotia town to study the cooperative movement and to learn skills they can take back to their own countries. At St. Francis Xavier University, Antigonish, this film shows the work of the Coady International Institute.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Another day in paradise
results.creator_credit: Larry Clark, James Woods, Stephen Chin and Chinese Bookie pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Larry Clark’s offbeat road movie delves into familiar territory for the always controversial director, that being the search for or absence of a familial or communal maxim. Based on a novel by Eddie Little, “Another day in paradise” follows the misadventures of two young criminal lovers and part-time junkies Bobbie and Rosie (Vincent Kartheiser and Natasha Gregson Wagner) who team up with the more experienced crime couple Mel and Sid (James Woods and Melanie Griffith) to commit a series of robberies across America. Bobbie, coming from a seriously dysfunctional family (with hints of physical abuse from his father), begins to form a strong familial bond with the childless Mel and Sid. The ‘happy families’ scenario begins to come apart however when the crew begin to get more reckless with their crimes, while falling heavier into drug use. Larry Clark (whose past photographic essays on teenagers inform most of his film work), adopts his usual languid style as the camera casually drifts over young bodies, their boredom only slightly elevated by sporadic bursts of violence. In contrast, James Woods gives his familiar intense performance, while Melanie Griffith imbues her role with a unselfconscious charm as the junkie substitute ‘mother’ for this ill-fated family. Cast includes: Lou Diamond Philips, Peter Sarsgaard.
